reviewText: True Story of the Mau Mau uprising in Kenya East Africa.
Partially informative,, definately presented from the perspective of the colonizers!! Very subjective narrative and obviously information is omitted!
very interesting period piece; great seller
This is just a piece-meal of clips, not a real film.
Different information. Didn't know all this was going on back then they way it was.
No close caption...am hard of hearing and rely on being so.

This video gives an interesting insight into the Mau-Mau uprising and fight for independence from Britain with all its attendant gore and violence. Recommended for anyone interested in the history of de-colonisation in Africa.
this is a part of history also not overlooking the terrible violence that existed in those times  - I was there!

This 1953 year production is a documentary of convulsive explicitly-cynic attempts to keep the shrinking empire intact and barbaric actions by local Kenyan "Negros" to get independence and sovereignty from undesirable non-invited strangers.

The world knows results that struggle ended in, what the modern geopolitical situation is and how terrorists and gorillas act nowadays in places even far remote from pristine Africa.

A surprising testimony to anti-colonial activities produced, perhaps, at the time for quite different reasons.
